intro: Macromeria exserta, commonly known as the slender sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered inflorescences and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it blooms during the spring and early summer. Macromeria exserta is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats, where it plays a role in local biodiversity.
